item.title: Alleged Co-conspirator LeBron James Reported to the FBI in Connection with McDonald‚Äôs RICO Case
item.description: Click on this link to visualize the original document: FBI-Submission-Successful-2024-05-21_at_1945_0800.jpg On May 21, 2024, at 19:45 China Standard Time (7:45 AM Eastern Time), I reported NBA superstar LeBron James to the FBI for his alleged participation in the criminal RICO enterprise involving McDonald‚Äôs Corporation and its accomplices. Given that LeBron James was likely paid millions to endorse a mass-marketing fraud, I believe the FBI must interrogate him to determine whether he knew about the fraudulent activities he was promoting.

item.title: Happy Birthday, Mr. President
item.description: Click on this link to visualize the original email: 2023-12-21-1800-0100-happy-birthday-mr-president.pdf From: Vincent B. Le Corre Subject: Happy Birthday, Mr. President Date sent: December 21, 2023, 18:00 +0100 To: Emmanuel Macron Click on this link to visualize the original email: 2023-12-21-1800-0100-happy-birthday-mr-president.pdf Mr. President, Exactly five years ago to the day, on December 21, 2018, I registered the domain name Macron-Emmanuel.com to launch an unofficial website about you, Mr. President. My intention has always been benevolent. As I have done for other high-level officials and magistrates such as Nicole Belloubet, C√©dric Villani, or Fran√ßois Molins, my aim was to raise public awareness not only of the serious crimes committed by the transnational criminal entity McDonald’s Corporation but also to highlight the recurring pattern of crimes of forgery and use of forged documents within the French judicial system.

item.title: ECTHR submissions

item.description: In the fall of 2013, Jean-Pierre Petit, who was then the CEO of McDonald‚Äôs France, authored a revealing book titled I Sold My Soul to McDonald‚Äôs. The title itself, a nod to the notorious phrase about making a pact with the devil, is quite revealing. The book turns out to be a crucial piece of evidence in the criminal RICO case targeting McDonald‚Äôs Corporation and its accomplices, especially in light of my direct alerts to the top executives at McDonald‚Äôs Corporation in 2015 about ongoing criminal activities by its subsidiary companies in Europe.

item.title: Third Formal Notice Sent to McDonald‚Äôs France and French Ministerial Office Regarding Fraudulent Practices
item.description: On May 30, 2013, I sent a formal notice through 6 certified mails with proof of receipt requested and delivered to McDonald‚Äôs France and the (corrupted) French Ministerial Office Henri-Antoine Le Honsec. I issued a stern rebuke against the deceptive practices endorsed by this French Ministerial Officer (called in France an huissier de justice: without his approval, the fraudulent sweepstakes could never have taken place). This notice served as a prelude to formal legal action, explicitly invoking the provisions of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA).

item.title: Mini-Cultural Genocide: McDonald‚Äôs Impact on French Gastronomic Traditions
item.description: On November 16, 2010, UNESCO recognized the gastronomic meal of the French as an integral part of the world‚Äôs cultural heritage. This recognition underscores a tradition that celebrates life’s key events through a structured and sophisticated dining experience. It highlights communal dining, the art of good food and drink, and a harmony with nature’s offerings. The meal typically begins with an ap√©ritif and concludes with liqueurs, encompassing at least four courses that showcase local products and traditional recipes, aimed at fostering social bonds and cultural continuity.

item.title: Erroneous Judgment in McDonald‚Äôs France Lottery Case Highlights Legal Missteps
item.description: Click on this link to visualize the original document: appel-court-of-paris_november_14_2003_case_2003_01523_legifrance.pdf Erronenous Mathematical Foundations of Legal Assessments by the Court of Appeal of Paris I directly challenge the judgment by the Court of Appeal of Paris regarding McDonald‚Äôs “Euro McPailles” promotion due to what I assert is a fundamental misunderstanding of the mathematical principles governing the game’s design. I am calling into question the court’s conclusion that both the paid and free entries provided equal conditions for obtaining prizes.

item.title: McDonald‚Äôs Summoned by French Interior Minister Over Illegal Lottery Allegations
item.description: An article written by Christophe Dubois and published in the French newspaper Le Parisien on March 22, 2002, serves as an important piece of evidence highlighting McDonald‚Äôs Corporation‚Äôs questionable activities in France, especially involving their interactions with the French legal system and law enforcement. It reveals that the company‚Äôs highest level executives were summoned by the Minister of the Interior due to concerns about a promotional game, termed Euro McPailles (which could translate as McStraws), which was suspected to contravene French lottery laws.
